intro: Osteospermum angolense, commonly known as the African daisy, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies, sunflowers, and thistles. The plant features showy, daisy-like flowers with yellow centers and white to pink petals. Its leaves are typically gray-green and hairy, adapted to arid conditions. Osteospermum angolense is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and landscapes.
